                                                                                      # 1.å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 017. å«æœ‰æ‰€æœ‰å­—ç¬¦çš„æœ€çŸ­å­—ç¬¦ä¸² (opens new window)

                                                                                      # 1.1.æŸé¢˜è§£-æ»‘åŠ¨çª—å£çš„è§£é‡Š

                                                                                      æˆ‘ä»¬å¯ä»¥ç”¨æ»‘åŠ¨çª—å£çš„æ€æƒ³è§£å†³è¿™ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ã€‚åœ¨æ»‘åŠ¨çª—å£ç±»å‹çš„é—®é¢˜ä¸­éƒ½ä¼šæœ‰ä¸¤ä¸ªæŒ‡é’ˆï¼Œä¸€ä¸ªç”¨äº**ã€Œå»¶ä¼¸ã€ç°æœ‰çª—å£çš„ r æŒ‡é’ˆï¼Œå’Œä¸€ä¸ªç”¨äºã€Œæ”¶ç¼©ã€**çª—å£çš„ llæŒ‡é’ˆã€‚åœ¨ä»»æ„æ—¶åˆ»ï¼Œåªæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªæŒ‡é’ˆè¿åŠ¨ï¼Œè€Œå¦ä¸€ä¸ªä¿æŒé™æ­¢ã€‚æˆ‘ä»¬åœ¨ s ä¸Šæ»‘åŠ¨çª—å£ï¼Œé€šè¿‡ç§»åŠ¨ ræŒ‡é’ˆä¸æ–­æ‰©å¼ çª—å£ã€‚å½“çª—å£åŒ…å« t å…¨éƒ¨æ‰€éœ€çš„å­—ç¬¦åï¼Œå¦‚æœèƒ½æ”¶ç¼©ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å°±æ”¶ç¼©çª—å£ç›´åˆ°å¾—åˆ°æœ€å°çª—å£ã€‚

                                                                                      ä½œè€…ï¼šLeetCode-Solution é“¾æ¥ï¼šhttps://leetcode.cn/problems/minimum-window-substring/solution/zui-xiao-fu-gai-zi-chuan-by-leetcode-solution/

                                                                                      class Solution
{
public:
    //originmpè¡¨ç¤ºï¼Œtçš„å“ˆå¸Œ
    unordered_map<char, int> originmp, myhash_s;
    bool check()
    {
        for (const auto &temp : originmp )
        {
            if( myhash_s[ temp.first ]  < temp.second )
            {
                return false; //å½“å‰çª—å£ä¸æ»¡è¶³â€œç¼©å‡â€æ¡ä»¶
            }
        }

        return true;
    }

    string minWindow(string s, string t)
    {
        
        //init originmp
        for( const auto & c : t )
        {
            ++originmp[c];
        }

        int ansL = -1;
        int Len = INT_MAX;
        int L=0,R=0;
        while( R<int(  s.size() ) )
        {
            ++myhash_s[ s[R] ];

            //ç¼©å‡æ“ä½œ
            while( check() && L<=R )
            {
                if( R-L+1 < Len )
                {
                    Len=R-L+1;
                    ansL=L;
                }

                --myhash_s[ s[L] ];
                ++L;
            }

            ++R;
        }

        return -1 == ansL ? string() : s.substr(ansL, Len);
    }
};

                                                                                      # 3.å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 040. çŸ©é˜µä¸­æœ€å¤§çš„çŸ©å½¢ (opens new window)â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

                                                                                      • 85. æœ€å¤§çŸ©å½¢ (opens new window)

                                                                                      # 3.1.å•è°ƒæ ˆâ­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int maximalRectangle(vector<vector<char>>& matrix) {
        int m = matrix.size();
        if (m == 0) {
            return 0;
        }
        int n = matrix[0].size();
        vector<vector<int>> left(m, vector<int>(n, 0));

        for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
            for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
                if (matrix[i][j] == '1') {
                    left[i][j] = (j == 0 ? 0: left[i][j - 1]) + 1;
                }
            }
        }

        int ret = 0;
        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) { // å¯¹äºæ¯ä¸€åˆ—ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨åŸºäºæŸ±çŠ¶å›¾çš„æ–¹æ³•
            vector<int> up(m, 0), down(m, 0);

            stack<int> stk;
            for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
                while (!stk.empty() && left[stk.top()][j] >= left[i][j]) {
                    stk.pop();
                }
                up[i] = stk.empty() ? -1 : stk.top();
                stk.push(i);
            }
            stk = stack<int>();
            for (int i = m - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
                while (!stk.empty() && left[stk.top()][j] >= left[i][j]) {
                    stk.pop();
                }
                down[i] = stk.empty() ? m : stk.top();
                stk.push(i);
            }

            for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
                int height = down[i] - up[i] - 1;
                int area = height * left[i][j];
                ret = max(ret, area);
            }
        }
        return ret;
    }
};

                                                                                      ä½œè€…ï¼šLeetCode-Solution é“¾æ¥ï¼šhttps://leetcode.cn/problems/maximal-rectangle/solution/zui-da-ju-xing-by-leetcode-solution-bjlu/ æ¥æºï¼šåŠ›æ‰£ï¼ˆLeetCodeï¼‰ è‘—ä½œæƒå½’ä½œè€…æ‰€æœ‰ã€‚å•†ä¸šè½¬è½½è¯·è”ç³»ä½œè€…è·å¾—æˆæƒï¼Œéå•†ä¸šè½¬è½½è¯·æ³¨æ˜å‡ºå¤„ã€‚

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int maximalRectangle(vector<string>& matrix) {
        int m = matrix.size();
        if (m == 0) {
            return 0;
        }
        int n = matrix[0].size();
        vector<vector<int>> left(m, vector<int>(n, 0));

        for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
            for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
                if (matrix[i][j] == '1') {
                    left[i][j] = (j == 0 ? 0: left[i][j - 1]) + 1;
                }
            }
        }

        int ret = 0;
        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) { // å¯¹äºæ¯ä¸€åˆ—ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨åŸºäºæŸ±çŠ¶å›¾çš„æ–¹æ³•
            vector<int> up(m, 0), down(m, 0);

            stack<int> stk;
            for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
                while (!stk.empty() && left[stk.top()][j] >= left[i][j]) {
                    stk.pop();
                }
                up[i] = stk.empty() ? -1 : stk.top();
                stk.push(i);
            }
            stk = stack<int>();
            for (int i = m - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
                while (!stk.empty() && left[stk.top()][j] >= left[i][j]) {
                    stk.pop();
                }
                down[i] = stk.empty() ? m : stk.top();
                stk.push(i);
            }

            for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
                int height = down[i] - up[i] - 1;
                int area = height * left[i][j];
                ret = max(ret, area);
            }
        }
        return ret;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 001. æ•´æ•°é™¤æ³• (opens new window)

                                                                                      • å‚è€ƒåˆ«äººçš„
                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int divide(int a, int b) {
         int dividend=a;
         int  divisor=b;
        //-2^31/ -1 = 2^31 æº¢å‡º
        if(dividend == 0x80000000 && divisor == -1){
            return 0x7FFFFFFF; 
        }
        if( 0x80000000==dividend && 1==divisor )
        {
            return 0x80000000; 
        }
        int negative = 2;//ç”¨äºè®°å½•æ­£æ•°ä¸ªæ•°
        //ç”±äºè´Ÿæ•°è½¬ä¸ºæ­£æ•° -2^31 -> 2^31 è¶Šç•Œï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥é‡‡ç”¨æ­£æ•°è½¬ä¸ºè´Ÿæ•°
        if(dividend > 0){
            negative --;
            dividend = -dividend;
        }

        if(divisor > 0){
            negative --;
            divisor = -divisor;
        }

        //è®¡ç®—ä¸¤ä¸ªè´Ÿæ•°ç›¸é™¤
        int result = 0;
        while(dividend <= divisor)
        {
            int value = divisor;//ç»Ÿè®¡å‡æ•°
            int quotient = 1;//ç»Ÿè®¡å•†
            while(value > 0xc0000000 && value + value >= dividend)
            {
                //value > 0xc0000000 é˜²æ­¢value*2æº¢å‡º
                quotient += quotient;//å¦‚æœå¯ä»¥ç”¨ä¹˜æ³• quotient*=2
                value += value;//å¦‚æœå¯ä»¥ç”¨ä¹˜æ³• value*=2
            }
            result += quotient;
            dividend -= value;
        }
        return negative == 1 ? -result : result;
    }
};

                                                                                      • æ¨¡æ¿é¢˜
                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    string addBinary(string a, string b) {
        if( 0==a.size() ) return b;
        if( 0==b.size() ) return a;

        string str;
        reverse( a.begin(), a.end() );
        reverse( b.begin(), b.end() );
        int one=0,two=0;
        int carry=0;
        while( one<a.size() && two<b.size() )
        {
            int num=carry+( a[one]-'0' )+( b[two]-'0' );
            carry=num/2;
            num%=2;
            str+=( num+'0' );

            ++one;
            ++two;
        }

        while( one<a.size() )
        {
            int num=carry+( a[one]-'0' );
            carry=num/2;
            num%=2;

            str+=( num+'0' );
            ++one;
        }

        while( two<b.size() )
        {
            int num=carry+( b[two]-'0' );
            carry=num/2;
            num%=2;

            str+=( num+'0' );
            ++two;
        }

        if( carry )
        {
            str+='1';
        }

        reverse( str.begin(), str.end() );

        return str;

    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 003. å‰ n ä¸ªæ•°å­—äºŒè¿›åˆ¶ä¸­ 1 çš„ä¸ªæ•° (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    vector<int> countBits(int n) {
        vector<int> res(n+1);
        res[0]=0;
        for(int i=1; i<=n; ++i)
        {
            if( i&1 )
            {
                res[i]=res[i-1]+1;
            }
            else
            {
                res[i]=res[i>>1];
                //res[i]=res[i/2];
            }
        }
        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int singleNumber(vector<int>& nums) {
        int Help[32]={0};
        for( int val : nums )
        {
            for(int i=0; i<32; ++i)
            {
                if( val & (1<<i) )
                {
                    Help[i]++;
                }
            }

        }

        int res=0;
        unsigned int tag=1;
        for(int i=0; i<32; ++i)
        {
            if( Help[i]%3 )
            {
                res+=tag;
            }
            tag*=2;
        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int singleNumber(vector<int>& nums) {
        int first=0,second=0;
        for( auto val : nums )
        {
            first= ( first^val ) & (~second);
            second= (second^val) & (~first);
        }
        return first;
    }
};

                                                                                      int hash_one[26];
int hash_two[26];
void sethash(string &str, int tag)
{
    if( 1==tag )
    {
        memset( hash_one, 0, sizeof( hash_one ) );
        for(auto & c : str)
        {
            hash_one[c-'a']++;
        }
    }
    else if( 2==tag )
    {
        memset( hash_two, 0, sizeof( hash_two ) );
        for(auto & c : str)
        {
            hash_two[c-'a']++;
        }
    }

    
}

//è®¡ç®—
int calc(int val)
{
    for(int i=0; i<26; ++i)
    {
        if( hash_one[i] > 0 && hash_two[i] )
        {
            return 0;
        }
    }

    return val;
}
class Solution {
public:
    int maxProduct(vector<string>& words) {

        int res=0;
        for(int i=0; i<words.size(); ++i)
        {
            for(int j=i; j<words.size(); ++j)
            {
                sethash( words[i], 1 );
                sethash( words[j], 2 );
                res=max( res, calc( words[i].size() * words[j].size() ) );
            }
        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    vector<int> twoSum(vector<int>& numbers, int target) {
        //å‡è®¾æ•°ç»„ä¸­å­˜åœ¨ä¸”åªå­˜åœ¨ä¸€å¯¹ç¬¦åˆæ¡ä»¶çš„æ•°å­—ï¼Œ
        //ã€åŒæ—¶ä¸€ä¸ªæ•°å­—ä¸èƒ½ä½¿ç”¨ä¸¤æ¬¡ã€‚ã€è¿™ä¸ªåœ¨ä¸‹é¢çš„ç®—æ³•ä¸éœ€è¦è€ƒè™‘
        int Left=0,Right=numbers.size()-1;
        while( Left<Right )
        {
            if( (numbers[Left]+numbers[Right]) >target )
            {
                --Right;
            }
            else if( (numbers[Left]+numbers[Right]) ==target )
            {
                break;
            }
            else
            {
                ++Left;
            }

        }
        vector<int> res;
        res.push_back( Left );
        res.push_back( Right );

        return res;

    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 007. æ•°ç»„ä¸­å’Œä¸º 0 çš„ä¸‰ä¸ªæ•° (opens new window)

                                                                                      • é‡å¤é¢˜-ä¸‰æ•°ä¹‹å’Œ
                                                                                      
vector<vector<int>> twoSum(vector<int> &nums, int tagert, int begin_index)
{
    int len = nums.size();
    vector<vector<int>> res;

    int left = begin_index, right = len - 1;
    while (left < right)
    {
        if (tagert == nums[left] + nums[right])
        {
            vector<int> cur;
            cur.push_back(nums[left]);
            cur.push_back(nums[right]);
            res.push_back(cur);

            while (left < right && nums[right - 1] == nums[right])
            {
                --right;
            }
            --right;
            while (left < right && nums[left] == nums[left + 1])
            {
                ++left;
            }
            ++left;
        }
        else if (tagert < nums[left] + nums[right])
        {
            while (left < right && nums[right - 1] == nums[right])
            {
                --right;
            }
            --right;
        }
        else
        {
            while (left < right && nums[left] == nums[left + 1])
            {
                ++left;
            }
            ++left;
        }
    }

    return res;
}

vector<vector<int>> trueThreeSum(vector<int> &nums, int tagert, int begin_index)
{
    int len = nums.size();
    vector<vector<int>> res;
    for (int i = 0; i < len - 1; ++i)
    {

        vector<vector<int>> solve = twoSum(nums, tagert - nums[i], i + 1);

        for (auto temp : solve)
        {
            temp.push_back(nums[i]);
            res.push_back(temp);
        }

        while (i < len - 1 && nums[i] == nums[i + 1])
        {
            ++i;
        }
    }

    return res;
}

class Solution
{
public:
    vector<vector<int>> threeSum(vector<int> &nums)
    {
        sort( nums.begin(), nums.end() );
        vector<vector<int>>res=trueThreeSum( nums, 0, 0);
        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int minSubArrayLen(int target, vector<int>& nums) {
        int res=INT_MAX;
        int L=0,R=0;
        int sum=0;
        
        while( R < nums.size() )
        {
            sum+=nums[R];
            while(  sum>=target  && R<nums.size() )
            {
                res=min( res, R-L+1 );
                sum-=nums[L];
                ++L;
            }
            ++R;
        }

        return INT_MAX==res ? 0 : res;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 009. ä¹˜ç§¯å°äº K çš„å­æ•°ç»„ (opens new window)

                                                                                      • æ»‘åŠ¨çª—å£
                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int numSubarrayProductLessThanK(vector<int>& nums, int k) {
        int n = nums.size(), ret = 0;
        int prod = 1, i = 0;
        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
            prod *= nums[j];
            while (i <= j && prod >= k) {
                prod /= nums[i];
                i++;
            }
            ret += j - i + 1;
        }
        return ret;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int subarraySum(vector<int>& nums, int k) {
        int Len=nums.size();
        if( 0==Len )
        {
            return 0;
        }
        

        map<int,int> mp;
        int Prefix=0;
        int res=0;
        mp[0]=1;//æ³¨æ„è¿™ä¸ªï¼Œè¿™æ ·æ‰èƒ½ä¿è¯å•ä¸ªå…ƒç´ çš„æ•°å­—ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥
        for( auto & temp : nums )
        {
            Prefix+=temp;
            //æ³¨æ„å†™æ³•æ˜¯ï¼šPrefix-k
            if( mp.count( Prefix-k ) )
            {
                res+=mp[ Prefix-k ];
            }
            
            mp[ Prefix ]++;
        }

        return res;
        
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 011. 0 å’Œ 1 ä¸ªæ•°ç›¸åŒçš„å­æ•°ç»„ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int findMaxLength(vector<int>& nums) {
        int maxLength = 0;
        unordered_map<int, int> mp;
        int counter = 0;
        mp[counter] = -1;
        int n = nums.size();
        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
            int num = nums[i];
            if (num == 1) {
                counter++;
            } else {
                counter--;
            }
            if (mp.count(counter)) {
                int prevIndex = mp[counter];
                maxLength = max(maxLength, i - prevIndex);
            } else {
                mp[counter] = i;
            }
        }
        return maxLength;

    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int pivotIndex(vector<int>& nums) {
        if( 0==nums.size() )
        {
            return -1;
        }
        if( 1==nums.size() )
        {
            return 0;
        }

        vector<int> Prefix(nums.size());
        vector<int> Suffix(nums.size());
        for(int i=1; i<nums.size(); ++i)
        {
            Prefix[i]=Prefix[i-1]+nums[i-1];
        }
        for(int i=nums.size()-2; i>=0; --i)
        {
            Suffix[i]=Suffix[i+1]+nums[i+1];
        }

        
        int res=-1;
        for(int i=0; i<nums.size() ; ++i)
        {
            //cout<<Prefix[i]<<"    "<<Suffix[i]<<endl;
            if( Prefix[i]==Suffix[i] )
            {
                res=i;
                break;
            }
        }
        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 013. äºŒç»´å­çŸ©é˜µçš„å’Œ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class NumMatrix {
public:
    vector<vector<int>> sums;

    NumMatrix(vector<vector<int>>& matrix) {
        int m = matrix.size();
        if (m > 0) {
            int n = matrix[0].size();
            sums.resize(m, vector<int>(n + 1));
            for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
                    sums[i][j + 1] = sums[i][j] + matrix[i][j];
                }
            }
        }
    }

    int sumRegion(int row1, int col1, int row2, int col2) {
        int sum = 0;
        for (int i = row1; i <= row2; i++) {
            sum += sums[i][col2 + 1] - sums[i][col1];
        }
        return sum;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 014. å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ä¸­çš„å˜ä½è¯ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    bool checkInclusion(string s1, string s2) {
        int n = s1.length(), m = s2.length();
        if (n > m) {
            return false;
        }
        vector<int> cnt(26);
        for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
            --cnt[s1[i] - 'a'];
        }
        int left = 0;
        for (int right = 0; right < m; ++right) {
            int x = s2[right] - 'a';
            ++cnt[x];
            while (cnt[x] > 0) {
                --cnt[s2[left] - 'a'];
                ++left;
            }
            if (right - left + 1 == n) {
                return true;
            }
        }
        return false;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 015. å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ä¸­çš„æ‰€æœ‰å˜ä½è¯ (opens new window)

                                                                                      bool cmp( int a[], int b[] )
{
    for(int i=0; i<26; ++i)
    {
        if( a[i]!=b[i] )
        {
            return false;
        }
    }

    return true;
}

class Solution {
public:
    vector<int> findAnagrams(string s, string p) {
        vector<int> res;
        if( p.size()>s.size() )
        {
            return res;
        }

        int index=0;
        int one[26]={0};
        int two[26]={0};
        for( auto c : p)
        {
            two[c-'a']++;
        }
        
        int Len=p.size();
        for(int i=0; i<Len; ++i)
        {
            one[ s[i]-'a' ]++;
        }
        if( cmp(one, two) )
        {
            res.push_back(index);
        }

        index=0;
        while( index+Len < s.size() )
        {
            one[ s[index]-'a']--;
            one[ s[index+Len]-'a' ]++;
            ++index;
            if( cmp(one, two) )
            {
                res.push_back(index);
            }
        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 016. ä¸å«é‡å¤å­—ç¬¦çš„æœ€é•¿å­å­—ç¬¦ä¸² (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int lengthOfLongestSubstring(string s) {
        int res=0;
        unordered_map<char,int> WindowsHash;
        int Left=0,Right=0;
        int Len=s.size();

        while( Right<Len )
        {
            //å³ä¾§å¼ºåˆ¶æ›´æ–°çš„,ä¸‹é¢å¿…é¡»ä¿ç•™ï¼Œå¦åˆ™++Rightä¹‹åä¼šæ›´æ–°
            char CurChar=s[Right];
            WindowsHash[ CurChar ]++;
            ++Right;
            //å³ä¾§éå¼ºåˆ¶æ›´æ–°çš„ï¼Œæœ¬éƒ¨åˆ†ä¸éœ€è¦æ›´æ–°
            

            //ã€ä½•æ—¶ä½¿å¾—çª—å£ä¸ç¬¦åˆæ¡ä»¶ã€ï¼Œä½¿å¾—å·¦ä¾§éœ€è¦æ›´æ–°ï¼Ÿæ”¶ç¼©ï¼Ÿ
            while( WindowsHash[ CurChar ] >1 )
            {
                char c=s[Left];
                WindowsHash[c]--;
                ++Left;
            }

            res=max( res, Right-Left );
        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 017. å«æœ‰æ‰€æœ‰å­—ç¬¦çš„æœ€çŸ­å­—ç¬¦ä¸² (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution
{
public:
    //originmpè¡¨ç¤ºï¼Œtçš„å“ˆå¸Œ
    unordered_map<char, int> originmp, myhash_s;
    bool check()
    {
        for (const auto &temp : originmp )
        {
            if( myhash_s[ temp.first ]  < temp.second )
            {
                return false; //å½“å‰çª—å£ä¸æ»¡è¶³â€œç¼©å‡â€æ¡ä»¶
            }
        }

        return true;
    }

    string minWindow(string s, string t)
    {
        
        //init originmp
        for( const auto & c : t )
        {
            ++originmp[c];
        }

        int ansL = -1;
        int Len = INT_MAX;
        int L=0,R=0;
        while( R<int(  s.size() ) )
        {
            ++myhash_s[ s[R] ];

            //ç¼©å‡æ“ä½œ
            while( check() && L<=R )
            {
                if( R-L+1 < Len )
                {
                    Len=R-L+1;
                    ansL=L;
                }

                --myhash_s[ s[L] ];
                ++L;
            }

            ++R;
        }

        return -1 == ansL ? string() : s.substr(ansL, Len);
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 018. æœ‰æ•ˆçš„å›æ–‡ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    bool isPalindrome(string s) {
        int Left=0,Right=s.size()-1;
        while( Left<Right )
        {
            while( 0==isalnum(s[Left]) && Left<Right )
            {
                ++Left;
            }
            if( Left==Right ) break;
            while( 0==isalnum(s[Right]) && Left<Right )
            {
                --Right;
            }
            if( Left==Right ) break;
            
            if( toupper(s[Left])!=toupper(s[Right]) )
            {
                return false;
            }
            else
            {
                ++Left;
                --Right;
            }
        }
        return true;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 019. æœ€å¤šåˆ é™¤ä¸€ä¸ªå­—ç¬¦å¾—åˆ°å›æ–‡ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    bool checkPalindrome(const string& s, int low, int high) {
        for (int i = low, j = high; i < j; ++i, --j) {
            if (s[i] != s[j]) {
                return false;
            }
        }
        return true;
    }

    bool validPalindrome(string s) {
        int low = 0, high = s.size() - 1;
        while (low < high) {
            char c1 = s[low], c2 = s[high];
            if (c1 == c2) {
                ++low;
                --high;
            } else {
                return checkPalindrome(s, low, high - 1) || checkPalindrome(s, low + 1, high);
            }
        }
        return true;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 020. å›æ–‡å­å­—ç¬¦ä¸²çš„ä¸ªæ•° (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int countSubstrings(string s) {
        int n = s.size(), ans = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i < 2 * n - 1; ++i) {
            int l = i / 2, r = i / 2 + i % 2;
            while (l >= 0 && r < n && s[l] == s[r]) {
                --l;
                ++r;
                ++ans;
            }
        }
        return ans;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 021. åˆ é™¤é“¾è¡¨çš„å€’æ•°ç¬¬ n ä¸ªç»“ç‚¹ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * struct ListNode {
 *     int val;
 *     ListNode *next;
 *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}
 *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}
 *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
public:
    ListNode* removeNthFromEnd(ListNode* head, int n) {
        ListNode * KthOne=head;
        ListNode * temp=head;
        int tag=false;//è¡¨ç¤ºé•¿åº¦æ²¡æœ‰å‡ºç°å°çš„
        int loop=n;
        while( loop-- )
        {
            if( nullptr==temp )
            {
                tag=true;
                break;
            }
            temp=temp->next;
        }

        if( tag )
        {
            throw "List Less than n";
        }

        //è¡¨ç¤ºæ­£å¥½åªæœ‰kä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹
        if( nullptr==temp )
        {
            ListNode * del=head;
            head=head->next;
            delete del;
            return head;
        }
        else
        {
            //æ•…æ„tempå¤šèµ°1æ¬¡ï¼Œè®©KthOneå¾—åˆ°å€’æ•°K+1çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹
            temp=temp->next;
            while( nullptr!=temp && nullptr!=KthOne )
            {
                temp=temp->next;
                KthOne=KthOne->next;
            }

            ListNode * del=KthOne->next;
            KthOne->next=KthOne->next->next;
            delete del;
            return head;
        }
    }
};

                {
                    temp=temp->next;
                    low=low->next;

    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 023. ä¸¤ä¸ªé“¾è¡¨çš„ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªé‡åˆèŠ‚ç‚¹ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * struct ListNode {
 *     int val;
 *     ListNode *next;
 *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(NULL) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
public:
    ListNode *getIntersectionNode(ListNode *headA, ListNode *headB) {
        //å…³äºï¼Œå¦‚æœæ²¡æœ‰ç›¸äº¤èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œæˆ‘çš„æ–¹å¼æ˜¯æ±‚å‡ºheadAå’ŒheadBçš„é•¿åº¦ï¼Œç„¶åè®¡ç®—ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯æ˜¾ç„¶æ²¡æœ‰ä¸‹é¢å¥½
        ListNode * first=headA;
        ListNode * second=headB;
        //å½“firstå’Œsecondéƒ½æ˜¯nullptrçš„æ—¶å€™ï¼Œè¡¨ç¤ºæ²¡æœ‰ç›¸äº¤èŠ‚ç‚¹
        while( !( (nullptr==first)&&(nullptr==second) ))
        {
            if( first==second )
            {
                return first;
            }

            //ä¹‹æ‰€ä»¥å¯ä»¥ä¸‹é¢è¿™ä¹ˆè®²ï¼Œå®Œå…¨æ˜¯å› ä¸ºï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬çŸ¥é“æœ€å¤šfirstæˆ–secondéƒ½æ¢ä¸€æ¬¡æ–¹å‘å°±ä¸€å®šè§£å†³äº†
            if( nullptr==first )
            {
                first=headB;
            }
            else
            {
                first=first->next;
            }

            if( nullptr==second )
            {
                second=headA;
            }
            else
            {
                second=second->next;
            }
        }

        return nullptr;
    }
};

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * struct ListNode {
 *     int val;
 *     ListNode *next;
 *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}
 *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}
 *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
public:
    ListNode* reverseList(ListNode* head) {
        ListNode * sentry=nullptr;
        while( nullptr!=head )
        {
            ListNode * temp=head->next;
            head->next=sentry;
            sentry=head;
            head=temp;
        }
        return sentry;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 025. é“¾è¡¨ä¸­çš„ä¸¤æ•°ç›¸åŠ  (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * struct ListNode {
 *     int val;
 *     ListNode *next;
 *     ListNode() : val(0), next(nullptr) {}
 *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(nullptr) {}
 *     ListNode(int x, ListNode *next) : val(x), next(next) {}
 * };
 */

ListNode * reverseList( ListNode * head )
{
    ListNode * sentry=nullptr;
    while( nullptr!=head )
    {
        ListNode * temp=head->next;
        head->next=sentry;
        sentry=head;

        head=temp;
    }
    return sentry;
}

class Solution {
public:
    ListNode* addTwoNumbers(ListNode* l1, ListNode* l2) {
        ListNode * first=reverseList(l1);
        ListNode * second=reverseList(l2);

        ListNode * dummy=new ListNode(-1);
        ListNode * temp=dummy;
        int carry=0;
        while( nullptr!=first && nullptr!=second )
        {
            int num=( first->val )+( second->val )+carry;
            temp->next=new ListNode( num%10 );
            temp=temp->next;
            carry=num/10;

            first=first->next;
            second=second->next;
        }

        while( nullptr!=first )
        {
            int num=( first->val )+carry;
            temp->next=new ListNode( num%10 );
            temp=temp->next;
            carry=num/10;

            first=first->next;
        }

        while( nullptr!=second )
        {
            int num=( second->val )+carry;
            temp->next=new ListNode( num%10 );
            temp=temp->next;
            carry=num/10;
            
            second=second->next;
        }

        if( carry )
        {
            temp->next=new ListNode(carry);
        }
        
        temp=dummy;
        dummy=dummy->next;
        delete temp;

        return reverseList(dummy);
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 026. é‡æ’é“¾è¡¨ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    void reorderList(ListNode *head) {
        if (head == nullptr) {
            return;
        }
        vector<ListNode *> vec;
        ListNode *node = head;
        while (node != nullptr) {
            vec.emplace_back(node);
            node = node->next;
        }
        int i = 0, j = vec.size() - 1;
        while (i < j) {
            vec[i]->next = vec[j];
            i++;
            if (i == j) {
                break;
            }
            vec[j]->next = vec[i];
            j--;
        }
        vec[i]->next = nullptr;
    }
};

                                                                                      # 9.é“¾è¡¨

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 027. å›æ–‡é“¾è¡¨ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for singly-linked list.
 * struct ListNode {
 *     int val;
 *     ListNode *next;
 *     ListNode(int x) : val(x), next(NULL) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
public:
    bool isPalindrome(ListNode* head) {

        vector<int> rt;
        int len=0;
        while( nullptr!=head)
        {
            ++len;
            rt.push_back(head->val);
            head=head->next;
        }

        int i=0,j=len-1;

        while(i<j)
        {
            if( rt[i]!=rt[j] )
            {
                return false;
            }
            ++i;
            --j;
        }

        return true;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 028. å±•å¹³å¤šçº§åŒå‘é“¾è¡¨ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    Node* flatten(Node* head) {
        function<Node*(Node*)> dfs = [&](Node* node) {
            Node* cur = node;
            // è®°å½•é“¾è¡¨çš„æœ€åä¸€ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹
            Node* last = nullptr;

            while (cur) {
                Node* next = cur->next;
                //  å¦‚æœæœ‰å­èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆé¦–å…ˆå¤„ç†å­èŠ‚ç‚¹
                if (cur->child) {
                    Node* child_last = dfs(cur->child);

                    next = cur->next;
                    //  å°† node ä¸ child ç›¸è¿
                    cur->next = cur->child;
                    cur->child->prev = cur;

                    //  å¦‚æœ next ä¸ä¸ºç©ºï¼Œå°±å°† last ä¸ next ç›¸è¿
                    if (next) {
                        child_last->next = next;
                        next->prev = child_last;
                    }

                    // å°† child ç½®ä¸ºç©º
                    cur->child = nullptr;
                    last = child_last;
                }
                else {
                    last = cur;
                }
                cur = next;
            }
            return last;
        };

        dfs(head);
        return head;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 029. æ’åºçš„å¾ªç¯é“¾è¡¨ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    Node* insert(Node* head, int insertVal) {
        Node *node = new Node(insertVal);
        if (head == nullptr) {
            node->next = node;
            return node;
        }
        if (head->next == head) {
            head->next = node;
            node->next = head;
            return head;
        }
        Node *curr = head, *next = head->next;
        while (next != head) {
            if (insertVal >= curr->val && insertVal <= next->val) {
                break;
            }
            if (curr->val > next->val) {
                if (insertVal > curr->val || insertVal < next->val) {
                    break;
                }
            }
            curr = curr->next;
            next = next->next;
        }
        curr->next = node;
        node->next = next;
        return head;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 030. æ’å…¥ã€åˆ é™¤å’Œéšæœºè®¿é—®éƒ½æ˜¯ O(1) çš„å®¹å™¨ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class RandomizedSet {
public:
    /** Initialize your data structure here. */
    RandomizedSet() {

    }
    
    /** Inserts a value to the set. Returns true if the set did not already contain the specified element. */
    bool insert(int val) {
        if( 0==mp[val] )
        {
            solve.push_back(val);
            mp[val]++;
            return true;
        }
        else
        {
            return false;
        }
    }
    
    /** Removes a value from the set. Returns true if the set contained the specified element. */
    bool remove(int val) {
        if( 0==mp[val] )
        {
            return false;
        }
        else
        {
            int pos=-1;
            for( pos=0; pos<solve.size(); ++pos )
            {
                if( solve[pos]==val )
                {
                    break;
                }
            }

            swap( solve[pos], solve[ solve.size()-1] ); //ã€æŠ€å·§ï¼Œæ‰¾åˆ°å¹¶æ¢æ‰ï¼Œè¿™æ ·èƒ½çœç‚¹æ—¶é—´ã€
            solve.pop_back();
            mp[val]--;
            return true;
        }
    }
    
    /** Get a random element from the set. */
    int getRandom() {
        int Len=solve.size();
        if( 0==Len )
        {
            return -1;//éæ³•æ“ä½œ
        }
        return solve[ (rand()%Len) ];   //å­¦ä¹ è¿™ç§éšæœº
    }
private:
    unordered_map<int,int> mp;
    vector<int> solve;
};

/**
 * Your RandomizedSet object will be instantiated and called as such:
 * RandomizedSet* obj = new RandomizedSet();
 * bool param_1 = obj->insert(val);
 * bool param_2 = obj->remove(val);
 * int param_3 = obj->getRandom();
 */

                                                                                      class LRUCache {
private:
    struct node
    {
        int key;
        int val;
        node(int _key, int _val): key(_key) , val(_val)
        {
        };
    };
    //STLä¹‹åŒå‘ï¼›è¿è¡¨è¡¨ä½¿ç”¨
    //è¦ä½¿ç”¨unorder_map,å®ƒåº•å±‚æ˜¯æ•£åˆ—ï¼Œåªä¼šæ˜ å°„è€Œä¸ç”¨æ’åº
    list<node> mylist;
    unordered_map<int, list<node>::iterator> mp;
    int cap;

public:
    LRUCache(int capacity) {
        cap=capacity;
    }
    

    int get(int key) {

        //å¦‚æœæ²¡æœ‰è¿™ä¸ª
        if( mp.find(key)==mp.end() )
        {
            return -1;
        }
        else
        {
            int ret=mp[key]->val;

            node temp(key,ret);
            //å¦‚æœæœ‰
            mylist.erase( mp[key] );
            mp.erase( mp.find(key) );

            //èƒ½å¤Ÿç›´æ¥æ’å…¥ï¼Œå´ä¸ç”¨è°ƒç”¨putåˆ†æƒ…å†µçš„åŸå› æ˜¯ï¼šæœ¬æ¥å°±æœ‰è¿™ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œå¹¶ä¸”æ²¡æœ‰æ»¡

            //mylist.push_back(temp);
            mylist.push_front(temp);
            mp[key]=mylist.begin();
            //mp[key]=mylist.end();
            return ret;
        }
    }
    

    void put(int key, int value) 
    {
        node temp(key,value);

        //æœ‰æ—§çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œæ— è®ºæ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯å’Œå‰é¢ä¸€æ ·ï¼Œéƒ½å…ˆåˆ æ‰
        if( mp.find(key)!=mp.end() )
        {
            //å…ˆåˆ æ‰
            mylist.erase( mp[key] );
            mp.erase( mp.find(key) );

            mylist.push_front(temp);
            mp[key]=mylist.begin();
        }
        else
        {
            //æ¥çš„æ˜¯æ–°èŠ‚ç‚¹,å¦‚æœæ»¡äº†
            if( mylist.size()==cap )
            {
                //æ³¨æ„æ­¤å¤„ï¼Œä½“ç°äº†STLä¸­ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆï¼Œæœ‰endè¿˜è¦æœ‰rbeginçš„åŸå› 
       //å› ä¸ºendæŒ‡å‘çš„æ˜¯æŒ‡å‘æœ€åä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ çš„ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œè€Œrebginä½“ç°çš„å´æ˜¯å€’æ•°ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå…ƒç´ çš„ä½ç½®
                int num=  mylist.rbegin()->key;

                //mylist.erase( mp[num] );
                mylist.pop_back();
                mp.erase( mp.find( num ) );
            }
            
            mylist.push_front(temp);
            mp[key]=mylist.begin();
            
        }

        //è®°å¾—æ˜ å°„
       
       return;
    }


};

/**
 * Your LRUCache object will be instantiated and called as such:
 * LRUCache* obj = new LRUCache(capacity);
 * int param_1 = obj->get(key);
 * obj->put(key,value);
 */

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 032. æœ‰æ•ˆçš„å˜ä½è¯ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    bool isAnagram(string s, string t) {
        if( s==t )
        {
            return false;
        }

        sort( t.begin(), t.end() );
        sort( s.begin(), s.end() );
        return s==t ? true : false;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 033. å˜ä½è¯ç»„ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    vector<vector<string>> groupAnagrams(vector<string>& strs) {
        // è‡ªå®šä¹‰å¯¹ array<int, 26> ç±»å‹çš„å“ˆå¸Œå‡½æ•°
        auto arrayHash = [fn = hash<int>{}] (const array<int, 26>& arr) -> size_t 
        {
            return accumulate
            (arr.begin(), arr.end(), 
                              0u, 
                              [&](size_t acc, int num) {
                return (acc << 1) ^ fn(num); }
            );
        };

        unordered_map<array<int, 26>, vector<string>, decltype(arrayHash)> 
            mp(0, arrayHash);
        
        for (string& str: strs) {
            array<int, 26> counts{};
            int length = str.length();
            for (int i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
                counts[str[i] - 'a'] ++;
            }
            mp[counts].emplace_back(str);
        }
        vector<vector<string>> ans;
        for (auto it = mp.begin(); it != mp.end(); ++it) {
            ans.emplace_back(it->second);
        }
        return ans;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 034. å¤–æ˜Ÿè¯­è¨€æ˜¯å¦æ’åº (opens new window)

                                                                                      map<char,int> mp;
void init( string & str )
{
    mp.clear();
    for(int i=0; i<26; ++i)
    {
        mp[ str[i] ] = i;
    }
}

bool cmp( string &a , string & b)
{
    int i=0,j=0;
    while( i<a.size() && j<b.size() )
    {
        if( mp[ a[i] ] < mp[ b[i] ] )
        {
            return true;
        }
        else if( mp[ a[i] ] > mp[ b[i] ] )
        {
            return false;
        }

        ++i;
        ++j;
    }

    if( i<a.size() )
    {
        return false;
    }
    else
    {
        return true;
    }
}

class Solution {
public:
    bool isAlienSorted(vector<string>& words, string order) {
        init( order );
        vector<string> temp=words;
        sort( temp.begin(), temp.end(), cmp );

        return temp==words;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 035. æœ€å°æ—¶é—´å·® (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int findMinDifference(vector<string>& timePoints) {
        vector<int> help;
        for( auto & str : timePoints )
        {
            int a=0,b=0;
            a=(str[0]-'0')*10+(str[1]-'0');
            b=(str[3]-'0')*10+(str[4]-'0');
            help.push_back( a*60+b );
        }

        sort( help.begin(), help.end() );
        int Max_time=24*60;
        int res=Max_time;

        for(int one=0; one<help.size()-1; ++one)
        {
            int temp=help[one+1]-help[one];
            if( 0==temp )
            {
                return 0;
            }
            res=min( res, temp) ;        
        }

        res=min( res, (help[0]-help[ help.size()-1] + Max_time)%Max_time );
        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 036. åç¼€è¡¨è¾¾å¼ (opens new window)

                                                                                      • å¯¹åº”è¿˜æ˜¯å¥‡æ€ª
                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int evalRPN(vector<string>& tokens) {
        stack<int> stk;
        int n = tokens.size();
        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
            string& token = tokens[i];
            if (isNumber(token)) {
                stk.push(atoi(token.c_str()));
            } else {
                int num2 = stk.top();
                stk.pop();
                int num1 = stk.top();
                stk.pop();
                switch (token[0]) {
                    case '+':
                        stk.push(num1 + num2);
                        break;
                    case '-':
                        stk.push(num1 - num2);
                        break;
                    case '*':
                        stk.push(num1 * num2);
                        break;
                    case '/':
                        stk.push(num1 / num2);
                        break;
                }
            }
        }
        return stk.top();
    }

    bool isNumber(string& token) {
        return !(token == "+" || token == "-" || token == "*" || token == "/");
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 037. å°è¡Œæ˜Ÿç¢°æ’ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    vector<int> asteroidCollision(vector<int>& asteroids) {
        vector<int> st;
        for (auto aster : asteroids) {
            bool alive = true;
            while (alive && aster < 0 && !st.empty() && st.back() > 0) {
                alive = st.back() < -aster; // aster æ˜¯å¦å­˜åœ¨
                if (st.back() <= -aster) {  // æ ˆé¡¶å°è¡Œæ˜Ÿçˆ†ç‚¸
                    st.pop_back();
                }
            }
            if (alive) {
                st.push_back(aster);
            }
        }
        return st;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 038. æ¯æ—¥æ¸©åº¦ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    vector<int> dailyTemperatures(vector<int>& temperatures) {
        int n = temperatures.size();
        vector<int> ans(n), next(101, INT_MAX);
        for (int i = n - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
            int warmerIndex = INT_MAX;
            for (int t = temperatures[i] + 1; t <= 100; ++t) {
                warmerIndex = min(warmerIndex, next[t]);
            }
            if (warmerIndex != INT_MAX) {
                ans[i] = warmerIndex - i;
            }
            next[temperatures[i]] = i;
        }
        return ans;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int largestRectangleArea(vector<int>& heights) {

        vector<int> vec(heights.size() + 2);

        vec[0] = 0;
        for(int i = 0; i < heights.size(); ++i){
            vec[i + 1] = heights[i];
        }
        vec[vec.size() - 1] = 0;

        stack<int> stk;

        int area = 0;
        for(int i = 0; i < vec.size(); ++i){

            while(stk.size() && vec[stk.top()] > vec[i]){
                
                int h = vec[stk.top()];stk.pop();
                int l = stk.top();
                int r = i;
                int width = r - l - 1;
                area = max(area, width * h);
            }

            stk.push(i);
        }

        return area;

    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 040. çŸ©é˜µä¸­æœ€å¤§çš„çŸ©å½¢ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int maximalRectangle(vector<string>& matrix) {
        int m = matrix.size();
        if (m == 0) {
            return 0;
        }
        int n = matrix[0].size();
        vector<vector<int>> left(m, vector<int>(n, 0));

        for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
            for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
                if (matrix[i][j] == '1') {
                    left[i][j] = (j == 0 ? 0: left[i][j - 1]) + 1;
                }
            }
        }

        int ret = 0;
        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) { // å¯¹äºæ¯ä¸€åˆ—ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨åŸºäºæŸ±çŠ¶å›¾çš„æ–¹æ³•
            vector<int> up(m, 0), down(m, 0);

            stack<int> stk;
            for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
                while (!stk.empty() && left[stk.top()][j] >= left[i][j]) {
                    stk.pop();
                }
                up[i] = stk.empty() ? -1 : stk.top();
                stk.push(i);
            }
            stk = stack<int>();
            for (int i = m - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
                while (!stk.empty() && left[stk.top()][j] >= left[i][j]) {
                    stk.pop();
                }
                down[i] = stk.empty() ? m : stk.top();
                stk.push(i);
            }

            for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
                int height = down[i] - up[i] - 1;
                int area = height * left[i][j];
                ret = max(ret, area);
            }
        }
        return ret;
    }
};

                                                                                      class MovingAverage {
    queue<int> Q;
    int cur_Len;
    int set_len;
    int sum; //å½“å‰é˜Ÿåˆ—å’Œ
public:
    /** Initialize your data structure here. */
    MovingAverage(int size) {
        set_len=size;
        cur_Len=0;
        sum=0;
    }
    
    double next(int val) {
        ++cur_Len;
        Q.push( val );
        sum+=val;

        if( cur_Len>set_len )
        {
            --cur_Len;
            sum-=Q.front();
            Q.pop();
        }

        return (double)sum / (double)cur_Len;
    }
};

/**
 * Your MovingAverage object will be instantiated and called as such:
 * MovingAverage* obj = new MovingAverage(size);
 * double param_1 = obj->next(val);
 */

                                                                                      class CBTInserter {
public:
    CBTInserter(TreeNode* root) {
        this->root = root;

        queue<TreeNode*> q;
        q.push(root);
        
        while (!q.empty()) {
            TreeNode* node = q.front();
            q.pop();
            if (node->left) {
                q.push(node->left);
            }
            if (node->right) {
                q.push(node->right);
            }
            if (!(node->left && node->right)) {
                candidate.push(node);
            }
        }
    }
    
    int insert(int val) {
        TreeNode* child = new TreeNode(val);
        TreeNode* node = candidate.front();
        int ret = node->val;
        if (!node->left) {
            node->left = child;
        }
        else {
            node->right = child;
            candidate.pop();
        }
        candidate.push(child);
        return ret;
    }
    
    TreeNode* get_root() {
        return root;
    }

private:
    queue<TreeNode*> candidate;
    TreeNode* root;
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 044. äºŒå‰æ ‘æ¯å±‚çš„æœ€å¤§å€¼ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
public:
    vector<int> largestValues(TreeNode* root) {
        vector<int> res;
        if( nullptr==root ) return res;

        //BFSçš„å…¸å‹
        int cur_floor=INT_MIN;
        queue< TreeNode * > Q;
        Q.push(root);
        while( !Q.empty() )
        {
            cur_floor=INT_MIN;
            int Len=Q.size();

            for(int i=0; i<Len; ++i)
            {
                TreeNode * cur=Q.front();
                Q.pop();
                cur_floor=max(cur_floor, cur->val);

                if( nullptr!=cur->left )
                {
                    Q.push( cur->left );
                }
                if( nullptr!=cur->right )
                {
                    Q.push( cur->right );
                }
            }

            res.push_back( cur_floor );
        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 045. äºŒå‰æ ‘æœ€åº•å±‚æœ€å·¦è¾¹çš„å€¼ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
public:
    int findBottomLeftValue(TreeNode* root) {
        if( nullptr==root ) return 0x3f3f3f;
        
        int res=0x3f3f3f;
        queue< TreeNode * > Q;
        Q.push( root );

        while( !Q.empty() )
        {
            res=Q.front()->val;
            int len=Q.size();
            for(int i=0; i<len; ++i)
            {
                TreeNode * cur=Q.front();
                if( nullptr!=cur->left )
                {
                    Q.push( cur->left );
                }

                if( nullptr!=cur->right )
                {
                    Q.push( cur->right );
                }

                Q.pop();
            }

        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 046. äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„å³ä¾§è§†å›¾ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
public:
    vector<int> rightSideView(TreeNode* root) {
         vector<int> res;
        if( nullptr==root ) return res;

        queue<TreeNode * > Q;
        Q.push(root);
        while( !Q.empty() )
        {
            stack<int> temp;
            int curLen=Q.size();
            for(int i=0; i<curLen; ++i)
            {
                TreeNode * cur=Q.front();
                temp.push( cur->val );
                if( nullptr!=cur->left )
                {
                    Q.push( cur->left );
                }

                if( nullptr!=cur->right)
                {
                    Q.push( cur->right);
                }

                Q.pop();
            }
            
            res.push_back( temp.top() );
        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 047. äºŒå‰æ ‘å‰ªæ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
public:
    TreeNode* pruneTree(TreeNode* root) {
        if( nullptr==root )
        {
            return nullptr;
        } 

        if( 1==root->val )
        {
            root->left=pruneTree( root->left );
            root->right=pruneTree( root->right );
            return root;
        }

        //0==root->valæƒ…å†µ
        if( 0==root->val )
        {
            auto L=pruneTree( root->left );
            auto R=pruneTree( root->right );
            if( nullptr==L && nullptr==R )
            {
                return nullptr;
            }

            if( nullptr==L )
            {
                root->left=nullptr;
                return root;
            }

            if( nullptr==R )
            {
                root->right=nullptr;
                return root;
            }
        }

        return root; //ç»™ç¼–è¯‘å™¨åƒçš„
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 048. åºåˆ—åŒ–ä¸ååºåˆ—åŒ–äºŒå‰æ ‘ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(NULL), right(NULL) {}
 * };
 */
class Codec {
public:

    void DFS_help_serialize( TreeNode * root, string &str )
    {
        if( nullptr==root )
        {
            str+="null,";
            return ;
        }

        str+=( to_string(root->val) );
        str+=",";

        DFS_help_serialize( root->left , str);
        DFS_help_serialize( root->right, str);
    }

    // Encodes a tree to a single string.
    string serialize(TreeNode* root) {
        string str;
        DFS_help_serialize( root , str );
        return str;
    }


    TreeNode * help_deserialize( queue<string> &Q )
    {
        //å› ä¸ºQçš„ä¸ªæ•°å¿…ç„¶æ˜¯ï¼Œå®Œå…¨äºŒå‰æ ‘çš„èŠ‚ç‚¹æ•°ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥å¿…ç„¶ï¼Œä¸ä¼šé€’å½’åˆ°Qçš„sizeä¸º0çš„æƒ…å†µ
        if( "null"== Q.front() )
        {
            Q.pop();//ä¸€å®šè¦è®°å¾—popï¼Œä¸ç„¶ä¼šæŠ¥é”™ï¼Œå› ä¸ºå¤šäº†èŠ‚ç‚¹
            return nullptr;
        }

        TreeNode * root=new TreeNode( stoi( Q.front() ) );  //stringè½¬æ¢ä¸ºint
        Q.pop();
        root->left=help_deserialize( Q );
        root->right=help_deserialize( Q );

        return root;
    }

    // Decodes your encoded data to tree.
    TreeNode* deserialize(string data) {

        queue<string> Q;
        string str;
        for( auto &c : data )
        {
            if( ','!=c )
            {
                str+=c;
            }
            else
            {
                Q.push(str);
                str.clear();
            }
        }

        TreeNode * res=help_deserialize( Q );
        return res;
    }
};

// Your Codec object will be instantiated and called as such:
// Codec ser, deser;
// TreeNode* ans = deser.deserialize(ser.serialize(root));

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 049. ä»æ ¹èŠ‚ç‚¹åˆ°å¶èŠ‚ç‚¹çš„è·¯å¾„æ•°å­—ä¹‹å’Œ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}
 * };
 */
int res;

//æ³¨æ„ï¼Œä½¿ç”¨ä¸´æ—¶å˜é‡ä¼ é€’ï¼Œé€’å½’
void DFS( TreeNode * root , int cur )
{
    if( nullptr==root ) return ;
    if( nullptr==root->left && nullptr==root->right )
    {
        cur=cur*10+root->val;
        res+=cur;
        return ;
    }

    if( nullptr!=root->left )
    {
        DFS( root->left, cur*10+root->val );
    }

    if( nullptr!=root->right )
    {
        DFS( root->right, cur*10+root->val );
    }
}

class Solution {
public:
    int sumNumbers(TreeNode* root) {
        if( nullptr==root )
        {
            return 0;
        }
        res=0;
        DFS(root,0);

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 050. å‘ä¸‹çš„è·¯å¾„èŠ‚ç‚¹ä¹‹å’Œ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    unordered_map<long long, int> prefix;

    int dfs(TreeNode *root, long long curr, int targetSum) {
        if (!root) {
            return 0;
        }

        int ret = 0;
        curr += root->val;
        if (prefix.count(curr - targetSum)) {
            ret = prefix[curr - targetSum];
        }

        prefix[curr]++;
        ret += dfs(root->left, curr, targetSum);
        ret += dfs(root->right, curr, targetSum);
        prefix[curr]--;

        return ret;
    }

    int pathSum(TreeNode* root, int targetSum) {
        prefix[0] = 1;
        return dfs(root, 0, targetSum);
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 051. èŠ‚ç‚¹ä¹‹å’Œæœ€å¤§çš„è·¯å¾„ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}
 * };
 */
class Solution {
public:
    int res;
    //è·å¾—å½“å‰èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œï¼ˆå·¦è¾¹orå³è¾¹ï¼‰+cur.valçš„ï¼Œè¿™ä¸€å•æ”¯è„‰çš„ã€å’Œã€get
    //æ˜¾ç„¶ï¼Œæœ€ç»ˆé—®é¢˜å°±è½¬æ¢ä¸ºï¼šè·¯å¾„å’Œ=getLeft+getRight+Cur.val
    int getCurNodeLeftOrRightDepthSum( TreeNode *root )
    {
        if( nullptr==root )
        {
            return 0;
        }

        //æ³¨æ„ï¼Œä¹‹æ‰€ä»¥é€‰æ‹©max(0)å»æ¯”ï¼Œå› ä¸ºNode.valå¦‚æœ<0ï¼Œé‚£æˆ‘è¿˜ä¸å¦‚ä¸é€‰è¿™ä¸ªåˆ†æ”¯
        int LeftVal=max( 0, getCurNodeLeftOrRightDepthSum(root->left) );
        int Rightval=max( 0, getCurNodeLeftOrRightDepthSum(root->right) );

        //æ³¨æ„ï¼šroot->valç‰µå¤´çš„å•æ”¯è„‰ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ï¼Œå°±ç®—è‡ªå·±<0ï¼Œä¹Ÿå¾—åŠ 
        return root->val + max( LeftVal, Rightval );
    }

    int solve( TreeNode *root )
    {
        if( nullptr==root )
        {
            return 0;
        }

        int LeftVal=max( 0, solve(root->left) );
        int Rightval=max( 0, solve(root->right) );

        //è¿™æ˜¯dpçš„åœ°æ–¹ï¼Œæ€»å½’æœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªç‰µå¤´èŠ‚ç‚¹ï¼Œæ­£å¥½
        res=max( res, root->val+ LeftVal +Rightval );
        
        return root->val + max( LeftVal, Rightval );
    }

    int maxPathSum(TreeNode* root) {
        res=INT_MIN;
        solve( root );
        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}
 * };
 */
TreeNode * head,*pre_node;
void recursion( TreeNode * root )
{
    if( nullptr==root )
    {
        return ;
    }

    recursion( root->left );
    pre_node->right=root;
    root->right=root->right;
    root->left=nullptr;

    pre_node=root;

    recursion( root->right );
}
class Solution {
public:
    TreeNode* increasingBST(TreeNode* root) {
        head=new TreeNode(0x3f3f3f3f);
        pre_node=head;
        recursion( root );

        return head->right;
    }
};

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(NULL), right(NULL) {}
 * };
 */

vector< TreeNode * > vec;
void solve( TreeNode * root )
{
    if( nullptr==root )
    {
        return ;
    }

    solve( root->left );
    vec.push_back( root );
    solve( root->right );
}
class Solution {
public:
    TreeNode* inorderSuccessor(TreeNode* root, TreeNode* p) {
        vec.clear();
        solve( root );
        vec.push_back( nullptr );

        TreeNode * res=nullptr;
        for(int i=0; i<vec.size()-1; ++i)
        {
            if( p==vec[i] )
            {
                res=vec[i+1];
                break;
            }
        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}
 * };
 */
int global_sum=0;
void solve( TreeNode * root)
{
    if( nullptr==root ) return;
    solve( root->right );
    global_sum+= (root->val);
    root->val = global_sum;
    solve( root->left );
}
class Solution {
public:
    TreeNode* convertBST(TreeNode* root) {
        //éå†å³ï¼Œä¸­ï¼Œå·¦ï¼ˆç´¯è®¡ï¼‰
        global_sum=0;
        solve( root );
        return root;
    }
};

                                                                                      class BSTIterator {
private:
    void inorder(TreeNode* root, vector<int>& res) {
        if (!root) {
            return;
        }
        inorder(root->left, res);
        res.push_back(root->val);
        inorder(root->right, res);
    }
    vector<int> inorderTraversal(TreeNode* root) {
        vector<int> res;
        inorder(root, res);
        return res;
    }
    
    vector<int> arr;
    int idx;
public:
    BSTIterator(TreeNode* root): idx(0), arr(inorderTraversal(root)) {}
    
    int next() {
        return arr[idx++];
    }
    
    bool hasNext() {
        return (idx < arr.size());
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 056. äºŒå‰æœç´¢æ ‘ä¸­ä¸¤ä¸ªèŠ‚ç‚¹ä¹‹å’Œ (opens new window)

                                                                                      /**
 * Definition for a binary tree node.
 * struct TreeNode {
 *     int val;
 *     TreeNode *left;
 *     TreeNode *right;
 *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}
 *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}
 * };
 */

vector<int> help;
void DFS(TreeNode *root)
{
    if (nullptr == root)
        return;

    DFS(root->left);
    help.push_back(root->val);
    DFS(root->right);
}

class Solution
{
public:
    bool findTarget(TreeNode *root, int k)
    {
        help.clear();
        DFS(root);

        int left = 0, right = help.size() - 1;
        while (left < right)
        {
            if (k == help[left] + help[right])
            {
                return true;
            }
            else if (k > help[left] + help[right])
            {
                while (left < right && help[left] == help[left + 1])
                {
                    ++left;
                }
                ++left;
            }
            else
            {
                while (left < right && help[right - 1] == help[right])
                {
                    --right;
                }
                --right;
            }
        }

        return false;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 057. å€¼å’Œä¸‹æ ‡ä¹‹å·®éƒ½åœ¨ç»™å®šçš„èŒƒå›´å†… (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    bool containsNearbyAlmostDuplicate(vector<int>& nums, int k, int t) {
        int n = nums.size();
        set<int> rec;
        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
            auto iter = rec.lower_bound(max(nums[i], INT_MIN + t) - t);
            if (iter != rec.end() && *iter <= min(nums[i], INT_MAX - t) + t) {
                return true;
            }
            rec.insert(nums[i]);
            if (i >= k) {
                rec.erase(nums[i - k]);
            }
        }
        return false;
    }
};

                                                                                      class MyCalendar {
    vector<pair<int, int>> booked;

public:
    bool book(int start, int end) {
        for (auto &[l, r] : booked) {
            if (l < end && start < r) {
                return false;
            }
        }
        booked.emplace_back(start, end);
        return true;
    }
};

                                                                                      class KthLargest {
public:
    KthLargest(int k, vector<int>& nums) {
        curK=k;
        for( auto val : nums )
        {
            add(val);
        }
    }
    
    int add(int val) {
        if( SmallHeap.size()<curK )
        {
            SmallHeap.push(val);
        }
        else
        {
            if( val>SmallHeap.top() )
            {
                SmallHeap.pop();
                SmallHeap.push(val);
            }
        }

        return SmallHeap.top();
    }
private:
    priority_queue<int, vector<int> , greater<int> > SmallHeap; //å°é¡¶å †
    int curK;
};

/**
 * Your KthLargest object will be instantiated and called as such:
 * KthLargest* obj = new KthLargest(k, nums);
 * int param_1 = obj->add(val);
 */

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 060. å‡ºç°é¢‘ç‡æœ€é«˜çš„ k ä¸ªæ•°å­— (opens new window)

                                                                                      bool cmp( pair<int,int> a, pair<int,int> b)
{
    return a.second>b.second;
}

class Solution {
public:
    vector<int> topKFrequent(vector<int>& nums, int k) {
        unordered_map<int,int> mp;
        for( auto &val : nums )
        {
            mp[val]++;
        }
        vector< pair<int,int> > help;
        for( auto &temp : mp )
        {
            help.push_back( temp );
        }

        sort( help.begin(), help.end(), cmp );
        vector<int> res;
        for(int i=0; i<k; ++i)
        {
            res.push_back( help[i].first );
        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    vector<vector<int>> kSmallestPairs(vector<int>& nums1, vector<int>& nums2, int k) {
        
        auto cmp = [&nums1, &nums2](const pair<int, int> & a, const pair<int, int> & b) {
            return nums1[a.first] + nums2[a.second] > nums1[b.first] + nums2[b.second];
        };

        int m = nums1.size();
        int n = nums2.size();
        vector<vector<int>> ans;   
        priority_queue<pair<int, int>, vector<pair<int, int>>, decltype(cmp)> pq(cmp);
        for (int i = 0; i < min(k, m); i++) {
            pq.emplace(i, 0);
        }
        while (k-- > 0 && !pq.empty()) {
            auto [x, y] = pq.top(); 
            pq.pop();
            ans.emplace_back(initializer_list<int>{nums1[x], nums2[y]});
            if (y + 1 < n) {
                pq.emplace(x, y + 1);
            }
        }

        return ans;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Trie {

private:
    bool isEnd;//æ ‡è®°æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯å•è¯ç»“æŸ
    Trie* next[26];

public:
    /** Initialize your data structure here. */
    Trie() 
    {
        isEnd = false;
        memset(next, 0, sizeof(next));  
    }
    
    /** Inserts a word into the trie. */
    void insert(string word) 
    {
        Trie* node = this;

        int len=word.size();
        //for (char c : word) 
        for (int i=0; i<len; ++i) 
        {
            char c=word[i];
            if (node->next[c-'a'] == NULL) 
            {
                node->next[c-'a'] = new Trie();
            }
            node = node->next[c-'a'];
        }
        node->isEnd = true;
    }
    
    /** Returns if the word is in the trie. */
    bool search(string word) 
    {
        Trie* node = this;
        for (char c : word) 
        {
            node = node->next[c - 'a'];
            if (node == NULL) 
            {
                return false;
            }
        }
        //å€ŸåŠ©isEndæ¥çœ‹æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯æœ€ç»ˆçš„èŠ‚ç‚¹
        return node->isEnd;
    }
    
    /** Returns if there is any word in the trie that starts with the given prefix. */
    bool startsWith(string prefix) 
    {
        Trie* node = this;
        for (char c : prefix) 
        {
            node = node->next[c-'a'];
            if (node == NULL) {
                return false;
            }
        }

        //æ¯”å¦‚ï¼Œappleçš„å‰ç¼€å¯ä»¥æ˜¯app,apple
        return true;
    }
};

                                                                                      # å‰‘æŒ‡ Offer II 063. æ›¿æ¢å•è¯ (opens new window)

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    vector<string_view> split(string &str, char ch) {
        int pos = 0;
        int start = 0;
        string_view s(str);
        vector<string_view> ret;
        while (pos < s.size()) {
            while (pos < s.size() && s[pos] == ch) {
                pos++;
            }
            start = pos;
            while (pos < s.size() && s[pos] != ch) {
                pos++;
            }
            if (start < s.size()) {
                ret.emplace_back(s.substr(start, pos - start));
            }
        }
        return ret;
    }

    string replaceWords(vector<string>& dictionary, string sentence) {
        unordered_set<string_view> dictionarySet;
        for (auto &root : dictionary) {
            dictionarySet.emplace(root);
        }
        vector<string_view> words = split(sentence, ' ');
        for (auto &word : words) {
            for (int j = 0; j < word.size(); j++) {
                if (dictionarySet.count(word.substr(0, 1 + j))) {
                    word = word.substr(0, 1 + j);
                    break;
                }
            }
        }
        string ans;
        for (int i = 0; i < words.size() - 1; i++) {
            ans.append(words[i]);
            ans.append(" ");
        }
        ans.append(words.back());
        return ans;
    }
};

                                                                                      class MagicDictionary {
    vector<string> inner_strs;
public:
    /** Initialize your data structure here. */
    MagicDictionary() {
        inner_strs.clear();
    }
    
    void buildDict(vector<string> dictionary) {
        for( auto & str : dictionary )
        {
            inner_strs.push_back( str );
        }
    }
    
    bool search(string searchWord) {
        
        for( auto & str : inner_strs )
        {
            int flag=0;
            if( str.size()!=searchWord.size() )
            {
                continue;
            }

            for(int index=0; index<str.size(); ++index)
            {
                if( str[index]!=searchWord[index] )
                {
                    ++flag;
                }
            }

            //æ³¨æ„æ ·ä¾‹ï¼šflag==1æ‰è¡Œï¼Œä¸€æ¨¡ä¸€æ ·ä¸è¡Œ
            if( 1==flag )
            {
                return true;
            }
        }

        return false;
    }
};

/**
 * Your MagicDictionary object will be instantiated and called as such:
 * MagicDictionary* obj = new MagicDictionary();
 * obj->buildDict(dictionary);
 * bool param_2 = obj->search(searchWord);
 */

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int minimumLengthEncoding(vector<string>& words) {
        unordered_set<string> good(words.begin(), words.end());
        for (const string& word: words) {
            for (int k = 1; k < word.size(); ++k) {
                good.erase(word.substr(k));
            }
        }

        int ans = 0;
        for (const string& word: good) {
            ans += word.size() + 1;
        }
        return ans;
    }
};

                                                                                      class MapSum {
    map<string,int> mp;
public:
    /** Initialize your data structure here. */
    MapSum() {

    }
    
    void insert(string key, int val) {
        mp[key]=val;
    }
    
    int sum(string prefix) {
        int res=0;
        for( auto & temp : mp )
        {
            //æ³¨æ„ï¼Œä½ç½®å¿…é¡»æ˜¯0
            if( 0==temp.first.find(prefix,0) )
            {
                res+=temp.second;
            }
        }

        return res;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
private:
    // æœ€é«˜ä½çš„äºŒè¿›åˆ¶ä½ç¼–å·ä¸º 30
    static constexpr int HIGH_BIT = 30;

public:
    int findMaximumXOR(vector<int>& nums) {
        int x = 0;
        for (int k = HIGH_BIT; k >= 0; --k) {
            unordered_set<int> seen;
            // å°†æ‰€æœ‰çš„ pre^k(a_j) æ”¾å…¥å“ˆå¸Œè¡¨ä¸­
            for (int num: nums) {
                // å¦‚æœåªæƒ³ä¿ç•™ä»æœ€é«˜ä½å¼€å§‹åˆ°ç¬¬ k ä¸ªäºŒè¿›åˆ¶ä½ä¸ºæ­¢çš„éƒ¨åˆ†
                // åªéœ€å°†å…¶å³ç§» k ä½
                seen.insert(num >> k);
            }

            // ç›®å‰ x åŒ…å«ä»æœ€é«˜ä½å¼€å§‹åˆ°ç¬¬ k+1 ä¸ªäºŒè¿›åˆ¶ä½ä¸ºæ­¢çš„éƒ¨åˆ†
            // æˆ‘ä»¬å°† x çš„ç¬¬ k ä¸ªäºŒè¿›åˆ¶ä½ç½®ä¸º 1ï¼Œå³ä¸º x = x*2+1
            int x_next = x * 2 + 1;
            bool found = false;
            
            // æšä¸¾ i
            for (int num: nums) {
                if (seen.count(x_next ^ (num >> k))) {
                    found = true;
                    break;
                }
            }

            if (found) {
                x = x_next;
            }
            else {
                // å¦‚æœæ²¡æœ‰æ‰¾åˆ°æ»¡è¶³ç­‰å¼çš„ a_i å’Œ a_jï¼Œé‚£ä¹ˆ x çš„ç¬¬ k ä¸ªäºŒè¿›åˆ¶ä½åªèƒ½ä¸º 0
                // å³ä¸º x = x*2
                x = x_next - 1;
            }
        }
        return x;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int peakIndexInMountainArray(vector<int>& arr) {
        int res=-1;
        int ret_index=-1;
        for( int index=0; index<arr.size(); ++index)
        {
            if( arr[index]<res )
            {
                return ret_index;
            }
            res=arr[index];
            ret_index=index;
        }
        return ret_index;
    }
};

                                                                                      class Solution {
public:
    int singleNonDuplicate(vector<int>& nums) {
        int res=0;
        for( auto val : nums )
        {
            res^=val;
        }
        return res;
    }
};
